verses.text: 主耶和華向我顯示，我就看見一籃夏天的果子。
耶和華說：「阿摩司，你看見甚麼？」我回答：「一籃夏天的果子。」他跟著對我說：「我民以色列的結局到了，我不再放過他們。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.

verses.text: 「到那日，聖殿的歌聲必變為哀號；屍首眾多，拋棄各處；你們要肅靜。」這是主耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Refers to a mournful cry, often of grief.
Implies a solemn and respectful silence.

verses.text: 踐踏窮乏人又除掉國中困苦人的，你們要聽這話。

words.note: Refers to those in poverty and lacking resources.
Refers to people experiencing hardship and affliction.
Marks the preceding phrase as a description.

verses.text: 你們說：「月朔甚麼時候過去，好讓我們可以賣五穀；安息日甚麼時候結束，好讓我們可以開市賣穀物。我們賣東西就把升斗弄小，收銀子卻用加重了的法碼，我們要用假秤欺騙人。

words.note: Refers to the ancient Israelite festival of the new moon.
Used to express purpose.
Lit. 'five grains', a general term for staple crops.
Lit. 'peace and rest day'.
Used to express purpose.
Indicates the object of the verb.
Ancient units of volume for grain.
Indicates a completed action or state.
Refers to scales tampered to give inaccurate measurements.

verses.text: 我們用銀子買窮人，用一雙鞋換取窮乏人；連麥碎也賣掉。」

words.note: Refers to the refuse or smallest particles of wheat, often of little value.

verses.text: 耶和華指著雅各所誇耀的起誓說：「我必永遠記著他們所作的一切；

words.note: Used to form a noun phrase from a verb, similar to 'the one who...'
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb, similar to 'the one who...'

verses.text: 「這地不應為此震動，所有住在地上的不應悲哀嗎？這地必像尼羅河高漲翻騰，像埃及的大河退落。
「到那日，這是耶和華的宣告：我必使太陽在正午落下，在白晝使地變成昏暗。

words.note: A common prophetic phrase referring to a specific future time of judgment or salvation.
More formal than '中午' (zhōngwǔ).
More formal than '白天' (báitiān).

verses.text: 「我必使你們歡樂的節期變為悲哀的日子，把你們的歌聲都變為哀哭。我必使你們各人腰束麻帶，頭都剃光了；我必使你們悲哀，好像喪了獨生子，自始至終都是痛苦的。

words.note: Refers to religious festivals or appointed times of celebration.
Preposition marking the object of a verb; 'take... and verb it'.
An idiom for severe mourning, referring to the practice of wearing sackcloth.
Shaving one's head was a sign of extreme grief or humiliation in ancient times.
Loss of an only son was considered the greatest calamity.

verses.text: 「看哪！日子快到，這是主耶和華的宣告。我必使饑荒臨到這地，這饑荒不是因為沒有食物，這乾渴不是因為沒有水；而是因為聽不見耶和華的話。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to a widespread lack of food, often used in biblical contexts.
A resultative complement construction indicating inability to perceive.

verses.text: 他們從這海飄流到那海，從北到東，到處奔走，要尋求耶和華的話，卻尋不見。

words.note: A resultative complement construction indicating inability to find.

verses.text: 「到那日，美麗的少女和勇士都因乾渴昏倒。
那些指著撒瑪利亞的罪（「罪」或作「亞示瑪女神」）起誓，或是那些指著但的神，或別是巴的神（「別是巴的神」原文作「別是巴的道」）起誓的，他們要倒下，再不能起來。」

words.note: Ancient city and region in Israel, capital of the northern kingdom.
Ashima was a pagan goddess worshipped in Samaria, mentioned in 2 Kings 17:30.
A city in northern Israel, associated with idol worship.
A city in southern Israel, also a site of pagan worship or mixed worship.
Can also mean 'truth' or 'the Way' in a religious context.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'those who swear...'
